entries.femaleVariant: Hey. What's your name?
Good morning. Please get up.
Mornin'.
Didn't expect to see you here, of all people.
[Sit up] Morning.
[Sit up] Anders Hellman. Who woulda thunk…
[Sit up] Is it morning?
Huh. Is it actually morning?
Heh. Life is full of surprises.
The sun rose over Night City exactly two hours ago.
Someone really ought to clean this mess up.
Whaddaya want?
They asked me to speak to you.
So you're here to speak to me. Whatever about?
You're back with the corp for good.
Mm, guess you're back in the Arasaka fold? For good this time?
entries.maleVariant: Guess you're back in the Arasaka fold. For good this time?

entries.femaleVariant: Fine. So what do you have to tell me?
Haven't had enough of 'em? The whole fucked up family?
entries.maleVariant: Haven't had enough of 'em? The whole fucked up family.

entries.femaleVariant: Arasaka will always get his way. And the new project is an excellent fit with my skillset. A prime outlet for my ambitions.
Why'd they send you of all people?
Wondering why they sent you of all people.
I am the bearer of bad news. Bad enough that it should come from someone you know.
As it turns out, I'm the only familiar face for thousands of miles around.
I fear I'm the bearer of bad news.
But the damage it wrought proved enormous. At the genetic level, altered DNA… the kind you would find in those suffering from radiation sickness.
Listen to me…
And sadly, it's lethal.
So I'm gonna die.
I don't believe you.
Fuck.
So you're tellin' me I'm gonna die.
No. I don't believe you.
Fuck. Fuck!
The procedure was a success. We removed the biochip.
The test results are unequivocal.
You could still be wrong.
Were I you, I would place my hopes elsewhere.
Things are bad, yes. But we have not given up.
There are other options?
How much time do I have left?
Wanna talk to Hanako Arasaka.
How much time I got?
Wanna talk to Hanako Arasaka.
What other options are there? Already gone under the knife once.
Approximately six months. Then, things will deteriorate quickly.
The time before your ultimate demise will be worst, most taxing.
I'm afraid that's impossible.
We had a deal.
And both sides fulfilled their respective ends. You, your case, your troubles no longer interest Hanako.
Hanako Arasaka promised to save my life.
Precisely why she sent me here to discuss your options with you.
Arasaka Corporation has the capability to cheat death. All we require from you is a dose of trust.
Trusted you once already. Fat lotta good that did me.
You may join our pilot program. "Secure Your Soul."
We have yet to solve the compatibility issue.
Not about to go to Arasaka's soul prison.
How do I know this isn't a trap?
How'm I supposed to know this isn't another one of your tricks?
Oh, so this has to be your sweet revenge. Look at you – your life's work has turned Saburo into a god. Yet here you stand, a mere mortal.
entries.maleVariant: So this has to be YOUR sweet revenge. Look at you – your life's work has turned Saburo into a god. Yet here you stand, a mere mortal.

entries.femaleVariant: My employer has made you an offer. We should finish discussing it.
So let's say I agree, land in Arasaka's soul prison, put myself at their mercy. Do I even need to ask about the catch?
That would make two of us. Why would I seek to punish my companion in distress?
All is set forth in a contract, guaranteed therein. You must merely sign it – if you wish to live, that is.
Mh, as it turns out, I really did die and go to hell.
entries.maleVariant: As it turns out, I really did die and go to hell.

entries.femaleVariant: Hajime.
Hajime, lemme ask you somethin'. What would you say to a person who walked right into their greatest foe's jail to save their life?
Hm. I would say, "All right. But do not forget the way home."
Saburo Arasaka is back.
So Saburo Arasaka's returned. In Yorinobu's body.
We live in strange times.
You're not freaked? That doesn't faze you?
entries.maleVariant: Not freaked? That doesn't faze you?

entries.femaleVariant: Half my life, I worked to give Saburo Arasaka immortality. In so doing, I grew accustomed to the thought of his… resurrection.
Can't get my head around it somehow.
Saburo Arasaka should be eating dirt already.
Real shame about Yorinobu.
It's not just his immortality. Saburo stole his own son's body.
Saburo Arasaka should be gnawin' the grass from below, rotting in hell.
entries.maleVariant: Saburo Arasaka should be gnawin' the grass from below, rottin' in hell.

entries.femaleVariant: Too bad for Yorinobu. He stands defeated in the worst possible way – cut down by his own nightmare.
entries.maleVariant: It's too bad for Yorinobu. He stands defeated in the worst possible way – cut down by his own nightmare.

entries.femaleVariant: Saburo is the first human to ever reach for and achieve a divine state. The gods stand above good and evil.
Hm. Dogs bark, yet the caravan rolls on.
A tragic figure, truly.
You never liked him.
One should speak well of the dead, or not at all.
[Stand] See you.
[Sign contract] I want to live.
[Refuse to sign] I'm going back to Earth.
It's no easy decision, I know. You should think it through carefully.
All the options have yet to be exhausted.
[Take cube]
There are no legal loopholes, no fine print. You have nothing to fear.
As do most.
[Surrender to Arasaka]
No. Alt Cunningham was first.
A surprising comparison. Yet accurate on many counts.
I fear your body is no longer of any use. You must abandon it.
There's no point in delaying. We can begin immediately.
See you… in the future. I hope.
Our staff will take it from here.
I wanna live.
Made my decision.
I'm going back to Earth. I'm goin' home.
entries.maleVariant: I'm going back to Earth. Goin' home.

entries.femaleVariant: You will die there.
Goodbye, Anders. Your offer was shit. But, in making it, you gave me something better.
Before, death was inevitable. A fact of my shit life. You let me choose it, accept it on my own terms.
entries.maleVariant: Before, death was inevitable. A fact of my shit life. You let me choose it, accept it on my terms.

entries.femaleVariant: What are you talking about?
And it has to do with you, actually.
A trick?
We will create an engram of your mind and store it in Mikoshi.
Store it? Why can't I just get a new body?
Doesn't sound like you had much of a problem with Saburo Arasaka.
You have no offspring. Nor do you have an entire clinic focused solely on your care.
Reprehensible place. I hate it. It could drive one insane.
The Arasakas have become gods. You are nothing to them. Insignificant.
Maybe Arasaka just wants to punish a pain-in-the-ass thief? Maybe Saburo wants another soul in his collection?
entries.maleVariant: Maybe Arasaka just wants to punish a pain-in-the-ass thief? Maybe Saburo just wants another soul in his collection?

entries.femaleVariant: Yes. See you.
[Sit up]
[Take documents]
Now, since a digitized psyche is not, legally, an individual, the contract entails relinquishing your rights. A temporary measure, naturally.
No. Not about to become the property of Arasaka Corp.
Current participants of the program are all well-known, influential people. We have yet to receive any complaints.
And if I refuse?
Your belongings are packed. A shuttle will take you back to Earth. And you will be dead before winter.
[Show middle finger]
[Return to Earth]
[Stand]
("A thing of beauty will never fade away.")
("I see your eyes, I know you see me, you're like a ghost how you're everywhere.")
[Take bag]
You really should get up.
V?
You must look at this.
Have you made your decision?
